TopicTitle: Sketching Models of Space Craft at...School

Articles.Content: Lol, so today I was sketching some basic horribly bad drawings of some Ships I could make when I got home. I was drawing it on my peice of paper I got for a test that I was taking home...Then a teacher came over and spotted me not doin' my test but drawing the ship, I got in so much trouble XD it was halarious!!! Am I bad for doing that?
I do that all the time. It's not bad, It's natural.
Try explaining the math behind it to your teacher, they'll probably have no clue what you're talking about..

Try explaining the math behind it to your teacher, they'll probably have no clue what you're talking about..

HAHAHAHAHAHA halarious FIST BUMP!
I've also found myself drawing spaceships into my notebook way too often. Well, it doesn't affect my learning much.
When we started doing something involving nasa and geometry in math I explained to my teacher the formula for delta-v and how orbital mechanics work

Try explaining the math behind it to your teacher, they'll probably have no clue what you're talking about..

Warning: this method has a high rate of failure in math and physics classes. It has a ZERO rate of success in all Language History and other non Math based subjects.

Teachers don't like for kids to blow their minds with Orbital Mechanics... even if it is just a game they get offended - although, name another way besides notecard memorization to feasibly get trigonometric functions in your head.
